node.title: Early season fire takes out mobile phones at Sisters Beach in north-west Tasmania
node.alt: Bushfire smoke rises above green trees
node.description: Mobile phone reception remains cut to a small town in Tasmania's north-west after a bushfire damaged telecommunications infrastructure.
node.content:
["A fire that has been burning at Sisters Beach in Tasmania's north-west has been downgraded again to advice level after it was briefly upgraded to\u00a0watch-and-act.", "That\u00a0fire \u2014 which started on private property near Lake Llewellyn on Saturday\u00a0afternoon \u2014\u00a0has\u00a0already burned\u00a0through about 450 hectares of land and damaged telecommunication infrastructure.", "Mobile phone reception is currently impacted in the area, and it is unclear when it will be restored.", "The fire had previously been downgraded to advice level overnight, but was upgraded to\u00a0watch-and-act on Sunday afternoon as conditions worsened.", "In an update issued shortly before 2pm AEDT on Sunday,\u00a0the Tasmanian Fire Service said the fire had been upgraded from advice level to watch and act, and that it may impact Lake Llewellyn later in the day.", "However, in a notification issued shortly before 4pm, the TFS said the fire had been downgraded and there was \"no immediate threat\" to Lake Llewellyn.", "The TFS said the fire is now being controlled west of Lake Llewellyn as it it slowly moves east.", "", "
The fire started on private property on Saturday.(Supplied: Nigel Weeks)
", "Incident controller Nic Deka said the fire had become more active throughout the day.\u00a0", "\"On the fire ground, we have winds gusting up to 50 kilometres per hour\u00a0from the north-east, predominantly they are about 35 kph but, given the nature of the topography and the nature of the fuels, the fire is getting more active as the day has warmed up,\" he said.", "\"We just need people to be aware of the fire nearby and just keep their ears and eyes open for further advice.\"", "Mr Deka said crews were focusing heavily on the area of the fire moving east towards Lake Llewellyn.\u00a0", "\"It is a concern, but moving towards the east it is having to back into the wind. It is quite active at different times, but we do have a fair weight of attack on that particular flank,\" he said.\u00a0", "He said there were five helicopters working to control the fire, along with seven TFS crews, seven Parks and Wildlife crews and four bulldozers.\u00a0", "\"The weather does warm up tomorrow and Tuesday and there's certainly no prospect of rain for the next week, so we will certainly have a laser focus once we've got the fire contained, to strengthen those containment lines,\" he said.\u00a0", "", "
The fire has so far burned\u00a0through about 450 hectares.(Supplied: Lisa Fagg)
", "Tasmania Parks and Wildlife Service is\u00a0helping fight\u00a0the fire, along with crews from the TFS.", "There is currently no evacuation order in place.", "Yesterday, helicopters were brought in to help fight the blaze which created a smoke alert for the Rocky Cape area.", "Waratah-Wynyard mayor Robbie Walsh said it was worrying to see a bushfire of its scale so early in the season.\u00a0", "\"Sisters Beach has only got one way in and one way out and it's a worry when a fire like this happens,\" Mr Walsh said.", "\"Sisters Beach is surrounded by national park, which is a very [high fuel]\u00a0area and it is a worry.\""]
